definition: to be as if.../to be rather like...
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago

sentences.english: They took possession. As if they were at a cocktail reception.
sentences.chinese: 他們佔據了舞臺，他們恍如就在雞尾酒會的接待入口。

sentences.english: The mist was scattered over the mountain by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 雲氣漫山，隨風四散，恍如隔世。

sentences.english: When I saw this poster, I got a feeling of walking back into an era of decades ago.
sentences.chinese: 看到這個標示牌，恍如回到數十年前的世代。

sentences.english: Paul showed he was out of touch with the modern world.
sentences.chinese: 保羅好像與現代社會恍如隔世。

sentences.english: And he stood as one in a dream.
sentences.chinese: 而他站在那裏，恍如夢中。

sentences.english: I found myself standing at the top of the sky, which was as clear as crystal.
sentences.chinese: 我恍如置身於水晶般清澈的蒼穹之上。

sentences.english: Suddenly in my eyes London resembles Chengdu, my dear hometown in a distance of age.
sentences.chinese: 突然覺得倫敦很像成都，我恍如隔世的故鄉。

sentences.english: But it seems like only yesterday that I made the decision to come here to study.
sentences.chinese: 但我覺得報名來着學習的那一刻卻恍如昨日。

definition: (literary) to be exactly like/to be exactly as if
